author: amylawrence.bsky.social
text:
The percentage of academy players who go pro is miniscule. A vast majority within academies anyway are 'training players' - there to facilitate the development of the one or two per age group with a chance. 

It's so hard to sell to kids that it is there to be enjoyed, without too much hope/pressure

text: And Barca will rue those missed chances because it's 1-1 at half-time. Vedat Muriqi levelled for Mallorca just before the break and I absolutely would have told you that earlier, but I the phone rang and I can't multitask without getting nosebleeds.

text: 3-1 Barca. Incredible outside of the boot cross by Lamine Yamal takes out three defenders, keeper can't come, and Raphinha has simple task of knocking home from six yards.

üîó bit.ly/3D7ppnz

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
FIFA has officially confirmed that the 2030 World Cup will be hosted by Spain, Portugal and Morocco.

Only one country can host the final, however, with three leading venues battling it out for the honour of doing so.

So, where will the final be held?

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Over a year after Saudi Arabia was left as the only candidate running to land the 2034 World Cup, their status as hosts was finally rubber-stamped by FIFA this afternoon.

Expect misgivings and scrutiny to run throughout the decade that will lead up to the opening ceremony in Riyadh.

author: bonitamersiades.bsky.social
text: And it‚Äôs not as if some (including me) did not warn against Infantino back in 2016. Football failed when it did not revolutionise after 2015. World sport was at a tipping point then. Instead it went for the all PR and no substance option. Now it‚Äôs well and truly tipped.

author: colinmillar.bsky.social
text: In 2010, there was genuine shock that Qatar's bid was awarded the 2022 WC. The bidding for each tournament was highly competitive. 14 years on, there is just numbness to FIFA's processes, the jarring hypocrisy, the damning reports, the human rights orgs criticism. All that now institutionalised.

text:
How do you beat Liverpool on Wednesday, then get taken to extra time by Tamworth on Sunday?

Ask Tottenham.

The National League side have more than held their own against Ange Postecoglou's team ‚Äî extra time beckons.

Spurs' first goalless draw under Postecoglou comes at The Lamb.

author: deanstewart.bsky.social
text: Tamworth deserved a replay. A full house and 45% of the gate receipts would have run the club for a couple of years. Well done #theFA for your shortsightedness. It's not always about the big clubs.

author: nickames82.bsky.social
text: No replay for Tamworth then, but at least the four or five most privileged & well-stocked clubs of the 745 that entered the FA Cup get a slightly lighter schedule!

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Never in doubt for Tottenham... üëÄ

Ange Postecoglou's side eventually get past Tamworth thanks to extra time goals from Dejan Kulusevski, Brennan Johnson and an own goal from Nathan Tshikuna.

Tamworth are 96 league places below Spurs ‚Äî you'd never have known on today's evidence...

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Bruno Fernandes thought he was fouled by Gabriel Jesus. The decision didn't go his way, much to the Manchester United captain's frustration.

He threw his boot in anger, and earned himself a yellow card.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
A sublime strike from Bruno Fernandes puts Manchester United in front against Arsenal.

Fernandes has now scored more goals for United than David Beckham (86 vs. 85).

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
A crazy few minutes at The Emirates swings the game back in Arsenal's favour.

Diogo Dalot, already on a booking, flies into a challenge with Mikel Merino and is shown a second yellow.

The Portuguese full-back had barely made his way down the tunnel when Gabriel equalised for Arsenal.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Altay Bayindir thwarts Martin Odegaard from the spot.

Kai Havertz was adjudged to have been upended by Harry Maguire, sparking a melee in the Manchester United penalty area.

The delay seemed to impact Odegaard, who saw his spot kick saved low to the Turkish goalkeeper's left.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
A red card, an equaliser, a penalty award, a lot of aggro, a penalty save...

All in the space of 10 minutes.

Arsenal 1-1 Manchester United.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
A combination of missed chances from Arsenal and some spirited defending from the 10 men of Manchester United mean it finishes 1-1 after extra time.

It's going all the way to penalties at The Emirates.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
The first half was a tough watch. The second half had it all. Extra time was tense. The penalty shootout was glorious for Manchester United, galling for Arsenal.

Ruben Amorim's side are through. Mikel Arteta's team exit the FA Cup at the third round stage for the third time in four seasons.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Two weeks ago, Joshua Zirkzee was jeered by a section of Manchester United supporters as he was substituted in the first half against Newcastle United.

Today, he has scored the penalty that sends them through to the fourth round of the FA Cup.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
The xG from Arsenal's FA Cup exit at the hands of Manchester United...

Arsenal 3.15 - 0.27 Manchester United

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
FA Cup holders Manchester United will play Leicester City in the FA Cup fourth round.

United overcame Arsenal in a dramatic penalty shootout on Sunday and will welcome back their former interim head coach Ruud van Nistelrooy, now at Leicester.

author: jamesbenge.bsky.social
text: You keep thinking that online football fandom has hit a low it can‚Äôt possibly dig deeper than. And then you see some of the most diabolical messages sent to the partners of those who happen to have had a bad game.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Kylian Mbappe gave Real Madrid the lead after just five minutes in the Supercopa de Espana final, but Barcelona have since taken control in Jeddah.

Goals from Lamine Yamal, Robert Lewandowski, Raphinha and Alejandro Balde in first-half stoppage time have put Hansi Flick's side 4-1 up at the break.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text: Real Madrid took the lead after just five minutes and Wojciech Szczesny was sent off after 56 minutes, but that didn't stop Barcelona from demolishing Real Madrid 5-2 in the Supercopa de Espana final in Jeddah.

author: beautifulgroan.bsky.social
text:
This is by no means an excuse because we're good enough to win some of these ties, but the last three cup exits have shown how rough our recent draws have been:

2022: Man City (4th round)
2023: Liverpool (3rd round)
2024: Man Utd (3rd round)

Those are literally our last three FA Cup games. Ouch.

text:

author: amylawrence.bsky.social
text:
When the concept of VAR was first mooted I liked the idea of experts with technology to advise on terrible decisions. It seemed unfair to refs that they had a split second and maybe a bad angle, while millions at home saw instant replays. 

But how can VAR, and assistant VARS, be this bad/mad? üßµ

author: amylawrence.bsky.social
text:
It is one thing ranting and raving about Oliver's weird decisions - or someone else's - there is always something somewhere that seems bewildering. 

But VAR is there, with assistants, and replays, and backup, to do the job of helping the ref if an instant judgement is off. 

It is not working.

text:
Brest almost ceased to exist in 1991 and in 2000 had fallen into regional amateur leagues.

As they were playing village teams, Real Madrid were winning Champions Leagues.

Now, the clubs from different footballing worlds meet ‚Äî and for the French side it is a miracle.

Tonight, they host Real Madrid, their Champions League dream still alive.

A fairytale? More like a miracle

text:

John Stones missed a great chance moments before Mateo Kovacic spared his blushes to haul Pep Guardiola's side level against Club Brugge.

They still need another one...

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

Joel Ordonez puts through his own net after fine work from Savinho and Josko Gvardiol.

As it stands, Pep Guardiola's side would squeak through in 22nd...

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Minutes after the high of scoring his first Champions League goal, Ollie Watkins is brought back down to earth as he skies a penalty against Celtic.

The England striker had the chance to add his second from the spot, but his standing foot gave way and his penalty goes over the bar.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Savinho might just have sealed Manchester City's place in the Champions League knockout play-offs.

The Brazilian lashes home to double his side's advantage against Club Brugge, who have posed a threat throughout.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Manchester City get the job done.

It wasn't smooth against Club Brugge - much like the rest of their Champions League campaign - but Pep Guardiola's side are into the knockout play-offs.

We will soon find out their opponents...

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Raheem Sterling saw his late penalty saved as Arsenal finish the league phase of the Champions League with a 2-1 win against Girona.

Mikel Arteta's side finish third with a record of six wins, one draw and one defeat.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
A much-changed Liverpool lose for only the third time this season ‚Äî but Arne Slot's side still top the Champions League table.

PSV make it through to the knockout play-offs with a 3-2 victory over the Premier League leaders.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
The league phase is over. 

Some European heavyweights are still fighting for a place in the last 16 of the Champions League.

Borussia Dortmund, Bayern Munich, Real Madrid, Milan and PSG are among the seeded sides in the knockout play-offs ‚Äî Juventus and Manchester City are unseeded.

text: Chris Wood becomes the first Nottingham Forest player to score a hat-trick in the top flight at The City Ground since Nigel Clough against QPR in December 1987.

text:

author: stevemadeley78.bsky.social
text:
HALF TIME
BLACKBURN 0-2 WOLVES
Much like the Bristol City game in the last round, Wolves haven't been scintillating but have produced more than enough moments of quality to merit their 2-0 lead, not least for the 2 goals. All about managing the game now. #WWFC

author: stevemadeley78.bsky.social
text:
FULL TIME
BLACKBURN 0-2 WOLVES
An impressively routine victory for Wolves. No real fireworks but sporadic moments of quality. With some better finishing they could have won by more but from the moment the went 2-0 up they never looked like giving it away. Very good game management. #WWFC

text:
I love that we have such breadth and choice of what we read/listen to/consume/think about. Growing up we only had papers and the radio. Very occasional punditry on very occasional TV broadcasts. 

Then came fanzines. Specialist mags. 

Then blogs, vlogs, podcasts, from all sorts. It's important!

Jarrod Bowen's goal was the difference as Mikel Arteta's side were reduced to 10 men for the fifth time this season after Myles Lewis-Skelly was sent off.

Arsenal now trail Liverpool at the top of the Premier League by eight points.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Spurs beat Ipswich Town 4-1 to register their first win at Portman Road since August 1994.

Kieran McKenna's side remain the only side without a win in the Premier League so far in 2025, drawing two and losing five - their longest run without a win at the start of a calendar year since 1990.

text:
Club Brugge have won just one of their last 16 games against English opposition (D3 L12) in Europe, conceding 42 goals during that time.

text:

text: Real Madrid have only lost one of their last 17 matches in the knockout stages of the UEFA Champions League (W11 D5), and are unbeaten in nine (W5 D4) since suffering the only defeat in this run (0-4 away to Manchester City in the 2022-23 semi-finals).

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Southampton are winless in their last nine Premier League away games against Liverpool (D2 L7) and have lost their last six visits to Anfield by an aggregate score of 19-1.

But they lead thanks to Will Smallbone's goal after he capitalised on a Virgil van Dijk error.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Normal service is resumed at Anfield inside three minutes.

Darwin Nunez equalised, before he was then brought down in the box. 

Mohamed Salah stepped up from 12 yards and you know the rest.

The Egyptian moves third in the list of all-time Liverpool goalscorers and they lead Southampton 2-1.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Mohamed Salah has now scored or assisted a goal in 13 of Liverpool‚Äôs 14 Premier League games at Anfield this season, including each of his last 12 in a row.

Only two different players have ever had a longer run of goal involvements at home in a Premier League season - who are they?

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Late heartbreak again for Ipswich Town.

Ismaila Sarr's seventh Premier League goal of the season has put Crystal Palace in front in the 82nd minute.

Palace have never lost a Premier League game against Ipswich (W4 D1), winning the last four in a row.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Joao Pedro wins, then converts a 98th minute penalty, as Brighton beat Fulham 2-1 at the death.

It's Brighton's first Premier League win against Fulham in 10 attempts and the first time since 1981 they have won four consecutive top-flight matches.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Since losing 7-0 to Nottingham Forest, Brighton have now won their last four Premier League games. 

The only team in English top-flight history to have won four in a row immediately after a seven-goal goal defeat are Grimsby Town, who lost 9-1 to Arsenal in January 1931.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Ollie Watkins scores his sixth goal in as many games against his former club Brentford to give Aston Villa the lead.

The England striker has been involved in 10 goals in his last 14 Premier League games in London, scoring nine and assisting one.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Aston Villa complete their first league double over Brentford since the 1946-47 campaign.

Ollie Watkins' goal is the difference against former club Brentford.

Having won seven of their first eight Premier League home games this season, Brentford are now without a win in their last seven.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social

Been thinking a lot today about that Maya Angelou quote:

1/4

author: amylawrence.bsky.social
text:
Firstly, every 31st March many, many people think about Rocky, David Rocastle, and how he made us all feel. This is a lovely clip about how even that lives on in a legacy. 

2/4

www.youtube.com/watch?v=UeO_...

author: amylawrence.bsky.social
text:
Then, there's Kevin Campbell, and how he made his mates feel. 

Was a pleasure to be on a special Handbrake Off podcast, linked to the work of the KC foundation, with Alan Smith, Lee Dixon, Paul Davis and Andy Cole. We spoke about old stuff and new, and Kev, of course. 

3/4 

pod.fo/e/2c06c2

author: amylawrence.bsky.social
text:
Finally, I spent the afternoon with a lot of people reminiscing about our dear friend Paddy Barclay, at a celebration of a life who made everyone who knew him feel lucky. Miss you mate. 

4/4

author: amylawrence.bsky.social
text: Am dipping over the 4/4 signature of the thread. But I guess the point is Maya Angelou was right. If you make people you know feel good, and remember those feelings whenever they think of you, that's a stellar thing to have in life. X

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
The recent threat of attacking corners in the Premier League has logically been followed by a focus on defending from corners.

The highest number of goals scored per 100 corners was last season‚Äôs 4.2.

That number has dropped this season to 3.3 goals per 100 corners - the lowest since 2019/20.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
The seeming improvement in defending corners across the league has resulted in more opportunities to attack on the counter.

Looking at counter-attacks from corners in the Premier League, the rate of counter-attacks per 100 corners this season (3.1) is higher than the previous two.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Liverpool have been most threatening on counter-attacks from defensive corners in this season's Premier League.

On defensive corners, Liverpool position Mohamed Salah and their left-winger, Luis Diaz or Cody Gakpo, in zonal roles by the penalty spot and near post - allowing them to break quickly.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text: If there‚Äôs a possibility of a short corner, Liverpool‚Äôs left-winger is the player tasked with defending it while Salah maintains his zonal role near the penalty spot.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
When Liverpool have scored counter-attacking on defensive corners this season, the positioning of Salah and Diaz has been instrumental.

In this example, against Brentford in August, Salah is near the penalty spot and Diaz is defending against the short option when Mathias Jensen‚Äôs cross is cleared.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text: The initial defensive position of Salah and Diaz puts them in the right place to attack on the counter when the corner is cleared.

author: amylawrence.bsky.social
text:
Brian Glanville. 

The maestro of his craft. A fierce critic, fantastic wordsmith, and a true original. Sitting next to him in the press box, it was a marvel how he picked up the phone at the end of the game, with barely a note, and dictated perfect prose off the cuff. 

An eternal bravo. Rest well.

author: amylawrence.bsky.social
text:
He was rather frightening when I started out. He was the king of the domain and if he held court you were lucky to listen. 

It took a while but eventually, to much surprise, he addressed me and asked me to verify a fact. Glanville! That was when I finally felt I belonged in football's press room.

author: amylawrence.bsky.social
text: Honestly I would sit there staring at the laptop trying to concentrate while he boomed in his distinctive baritone to some under-pressure copy taker. He's just riffing his whole piece. A ridiculous skill.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Is this the delightful underdog story of a football-mad guy who overcame prejudice and humble beginnings to rise to the top of the sport and cleaned up FIFA?

Or is it a Machiavellian story about the pursuit of power and allowing the game, once more, to be kicked about like a geopolitical football?

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Gianni Infantino is world football's most powerful man.

His presidency has been marked by the controversial men's World Cups in Russia and Qatar, as well as the awarding of the 2034 World Cup to Saudi Arabia.

But it is the newly-expanded Club World Cup that he hopes to leave as his legacy.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Bayern Munich race into a two-goal lead against Flamengo in the last 16 of the #FIFACWC.

An own goal from Erick Pulgar opened the scoring, before Harry Kane doubled the German side's advantage with a low strike from the edge of the area with less than ten minutes on the clock.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
He's hit that well.

A thunderbolt of a strike from Gerson brings Flamengo right back into their #FIFACWC last-16 tie against Bayern Munich.

Not even Manuel Neuer could keep that out.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Leon Goretzka restores Bayern Munich's two-goal advantage with a lovely finish.

After picking up a loose clearance on the edge of the box, he expertly directs his effort into the back of the net, leaving Agustin Rossi flat-footed in the Flamengo goal.

#FIFACWC

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Bayern Munich lead Flamengo 3-1 at the break, but should they have a player advantage as well?

Erick Pulgar was only shown a yellow card for this challenge on Harry Kane, before the defender had to be stretchered off for his involvement...

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Jorginho might be wearing different club colours, but he brings the same confidence from the penalty spot.

He hops, he skips, he waits, and he sends Manuel Neuer the wrong to score his first Flamengo goal, reducing Bayern Munich's lead to just one goal once again.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text: Premier League footballer Diogo Jota and his brother Andre Silva, a professional player for Portuguese side Penafiel, have died after being involved in a car accident in Spain.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Diogo Jota was a superb striker and a serial winner for Liverpool, Wolves and Portugal.

But he was far more than that.

He was a husband, a father and a cherished friend to the colleagues he leaves behind.

This is his story.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text: Ahead of the Euro 2025 match between Belgium and Italy, a minute's silence was observed in memory of Diogo Jota and Andre Silva.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text: Italy take the lead just before half-time against Belgium, with Arianna Caruso finishing well from inside the area.

author: nytimes.com
text: From @theathleticfc.bsky.social: Diogo Jota was a gifted attacker with a range of attributes. Yet football was only part of his story. Jota was beloved not just because of his prowess as a striker, but because of his warmth and friendliness as a human being. https://trib.al/68HtF5V

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
"A special footballer but an even better man."

Diogo Jota left his mark on all who met him.

Three Athletic writers who covered Jota at Liverpool and Wolves share their memories of a man whose gentle humility belied his remarkable success.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text: Italy get their Euro 2025 campaign off to a winning start thanks to Arianna Caruso's first-half goal.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Spain and Portugal observed a minute's silence in memory of Diogo Jota and Andre Silva before their Euro 2025 group stage match, with supporters paying tribute in Bern.

"You took the name of Portugal beyond borders. Now it‚Äôs our turn to raise your name."

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Goals from Esther Gonzalez and Vicky Lopez have given Spain a 2-0 lead over Portugal in Bern.

Gonzalez opened the scoring with less than two minutes on the clock ‚Äî Lopez doubled her country's lead five minutes later.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
It's only half-time, but Spain look to have sewn the game up already.

Two quick goals from Alexia Putellas and Esther Gonzalez just before the break have put the 2023 World Cup winners 4-0 up against Portugal.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Spain record their biggest ever Euros win.

Esther Gonzalez's double and strikes from Vicky Lopez, Alexia Putellas and Cristina Martin-Prieto see the 2023 World Cup winners deliver a statement victory against Portugal.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Diogo Jota won the Premier League and Nations League earlier this summer. Then on June 22 he married the mother of his three children.

In the early hours of Thursday, the Liverpool forward died in a car accident.

The Athletic reports from Zamora on what happened, and what has happened since.

text: Not like it hasn't been in the post but a dark day for Arsenal. The club should be ashamed.

author: hleehurley.com
text: We've all known who it was from the day he was arrested but couldn't say anything. That Arsenal kept playing him - and wanted to give him a new contract - will be a stain that may never wash out of the club.

author: nicwrites.bsky.social
text:
While I am relieved that he is no longer associated with the club, I am appalled at the fact that he was allowed to keep playing. 

There should be a full inquest as to how this decision was made.

Thoughts are with the victims after this lengthy and difficult ordeal.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text: Former Arsenal midfielder Thomas Partey has been charged with five counts of rape and one count of sexual assault.

author: 4jinxremoving.bsky.social
text: Let's not forget how the Spain victim said she contacted Arsenal, The FA, Ghana, and FIFA and nothing was done. It's all rotten to the core. Which is not news to anyone.

author: lgambrose.bsky.social
text: I want the manager asked about this in every press conference and interview all season, no matter how many times he offers no comment.

author: discoweapon.bsky.social
text: Everyone in a position of authority at Arsenal needs to be held accountable for this

Paris Saint-Germain take on Bayern Munich for a place in the semi-finals.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Four minutes into their first appearance at a major tournament, Wales are under pressure.

Jill Roord's powerful strike is parried into the air by goalkeeper Olivia Clark, who puts her body on the line to keep the ball out when it comes back down.

#WEURO2025

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Jill Roord goes close again for the Netherlands, but the post saves Wales!

The FC Twente midfielder latches onto a loose header and fires off an effort, which beats Olivia Clark all ends up, but cannons off the woodwork.

#WEURO2025

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Bayern Munich thought they had taken the lead on the brink of half-time against Paris Saint-Germain through Dayot Upamecano's header.

But it was subsequently ruled out for offside, even after his knee slide... meaning it is goalless at the break in this #FIFACWC quarter-final.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
The Netherlands finally break down Wales' spirit and resolute defence just before half-time.

Vivianne Miedema - ineffective for most of the match up to this point - strikes for her 100th international goal.

#WEURO2025

text:

#WEURO2025

text:

#WEURO2025

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Ousmane Dembele misses a golden opportunity to break the deadlock!

A rare Manuel Neuer mistake offered the Paris Saint-Germain forward a sight of an empty net, but Dembele cannot keep his strike on target for a certain goal...

#FIFACWC

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Desire Doue delivered in the Champions League final, and now he's delivering at the #FIFACWC.

His drilled effort from the edge of the area leaves Manuel Neuer with no chance, giving the European champions the lead against Bayern Munich late on...

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
This makes things interesting...

Willian Pacho is shown a straight red card for a challenge on Leon Goretzka, not long after Paris Saint-Germain took the lead.

Do you think his sending off was a deserved one?

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

#FIFACWC

text:

#WEURO2025

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

Desire Doue and Ousmane Dembele scored for the European champions, who ended the match with nine players after red cards for Willian Pacho and Lucas Hernandez.

text:

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
So little to choose between England and Spain, who will continue to battle for Euro 2025 glory in extra-time.

It's tough to pick a winner from here...

England simply will not be beaten.

They came from behind once again at Euro 2025 to beat Spain 3-1 on penalties and retain their European Championship crown.

The hero in two penalty shootouts, her prize is lifting the European Championship trophy.

Liverpool have the most players with four (or five given Milos Kerkez joined in the summer), whilst there are three representatives from Arsenal, two from Nottingham Forest, and one from Newcastle United.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Women's PFA Player of the Year 2024/25: Mariona Caldentey

The Spain international has won the women‚Äôs crown in her debut season for Arsenal.

She scored 19 goals in all competitions and helped Arsenal win the Champions League, defeating her former side Barcelona in the final.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Men's PFA Player of the Year 2024/25: Mohamed Salah

The Egypt international becomes the first player to win three PFA Player of the Year awards.

He scored 34 goals across the season for Liverpool, including 29 as the club won the Premier League, while also providing 19 assists.

text:

It's all gone wrong for West Ham United.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

The England captain is starting the new Bundesliga season as he means to go on.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
A goal for Moises Caicedo on his 100th Chelsea appearance and Trevoh Chalobah's close-range strike have put Enzo Maresca's side 5-1 up against West Ham United, who have crumbled.

Some West Ham supporters have already left.

text:

text:

text:

text:

A new season. More Khvicha Kvaratskhelia magic.

The Georgian picks the ball up inside the Atalanta half, runs past a defender and smashes it in from outside of the box.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Two Inter goals.

Two Marcus Thuram headers.

All smiles for the 28-year-old French forward who has put last season's finalists in command against Ajax in Amsterdam.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Bayern Munich's first goal was scored by Chelsea.

The visitors then gave them a penalty.

And Malo Gusto assisted Harry Kane for his second.

Enzo Maresca's side have been gracious guests for Vincent Kompany's team.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Marcos Llorente loves playing away against Liverpool.

He has scored four of his seven Champions League goals at Anfield.

His superbly struck volley, which deflected off Alexis Mac Allister, has Atletico level after being 2-0 down.

text:
Liverpool find a way past Atletico Madrid as Virgil van Dijk's injury time winner gives Arne Slot a nerve-wracking win on his birthday.

Marcos Llorente had threatened to spoil the party, but the captain headed home another late winner.

text: Diego Simeone was sent off after getting into a confrontation with a fan after Virgil van Dijk's late winner for Liverpool.

text:
Tonight's game between Newcastle United and Barcelona immediately evokes memories of the night Faustino Asprilla registered a hat-trick to help the hosts to a memorable win over the Spanish giants.

‚ÄòThe Barcelona Game‚Äô is a landmark in Newcastle‚Äôs history. 

Tonight could be another.

text:

The atmosphere is absolutely electric and Newcastle have started in ferocious fashion, too.

You would be hard-pressed to find a better atmosphere in Europe this week.

The Manchester City legend featured for just 26 minutes against his former club.

Marcus Rashford. Remember him?

The on-loan Manchester United forward gave the Spanish champions the lead against Newcastle United with a deft header, before unleashing a rocket past Nick Pope.

text:

Rashford has now been directly involved in 10 goals in 12 career starts against Newcastle (seven goals, three assists).‚Ä®‚Ä®üîó nyti.ms/3KaowhS

text:
Goals from Erling Haaland and Jeremy Doku gave Manchester City a 2-0 win against 10-man Napoli.

Captain Giovanni Di Lorenzo was sent off for bringing down Haaland on the edge of the box in the first half.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Erling Haaland‚Äôs goal means Alfredo Di Stefano drops out of the all-time top 10 goalscorers in the European Cup/Champions League.

For the first time, there are now no players from the European Cup era (1955-1992) in the top 10.

All 10 are from the Champions League era.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
It's Marcus Rashford's night on Tyneside.

The England international scores twice, including a stunning second, to give Barcelona a 2-1 win against Newcastle United.

The 27-year-old has now scored six goals in seven starts at St. James‚Äô Park against Newcastle.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
This was not how it all played out last night when Kevin De Bruyne's head hit the pillow.

Having been allowed to leave the Etihad stadium this summer for free after Manchester City decided against offering a new contract, the Belgian had arrived with a point to prove.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Unfortunately, his captain had different plans and inadvertently limited his homecoming to just 21 minutes.

Arsenal have one too ‚Äî Victor Gyokeres.

But is Arteta imitating Guardiola or vice versa? Or are they just adapting to wider Premier League trends?

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
London City Lionesses are searching for their first victory since being promoted to the Women's Super League.

Isobel Goodwin - with 31 goals in her last two Championship seasons - has given the side an early lead away to Everton at Goodison Park with her maiden WSL strike.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Manchester City look to be picking up where they left off after earning their first win under Andree Jeglertz last weekend.

Aoba Fujino has curled the side ahead away to Tottenham Hotspur after some nice link-up play in the build-up.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Tottenham had made the perfect start to life under Martin Ho, winning their first two WSL games.

However, they seem to be heading to a first defeat of the season after quickfire headers from Vivianne Miedema and Kerstin Casparij put Manchester City 3-0 up at half-time.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
London City Lionesses take another step closer to a first-ever WSL win - and they have Isobel Goodwin to thank once again.

Nikita Parris, playing against her former club, finds the unmarked Goodwin with a cross, and the striker makes no mistake from close range.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Everton have a goal back against London City Lionesses, but is it too little, too late?

Yuka Momiki slots home from the penalty spot to make it 2-1, scoring the club's first goal since making the permanent move to Goodison Park.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Grace Clinton's debut goal and Laura Coombs' stoppage-time effort secure a dominant win for Manchester City away at Tottenham Hotspur.

Olivia Holdt did grab a late consolation for the hosts, who suffer a heavy first defeat of the 2025-26 campaign - and under Martin Ho.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
London City Lionesses earn their first-ever win in the Women's Super League.

Isobel Goodwin's brace secures a maiden three points for the newly-promoted side, leaving Everton still waiting for a first win since moving to Goodison Park permanently.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Liverpool lead against Everton thanks to a superb Ryan Gravenberch goal. 

The 23-year-old made that look so easy, guiding a spinning, bouncing ball past Jordan Pickford.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
That's a hard-fought three points for Liverpool against Everton, who hold on to secure three points at Anfield.

Ryan Gravenberch and Hugo Ekitike's first-half goals gave the home side a comfortable lead at half-time, but Idrissa Gueye pulled one back for the visitors to make for a nervy finish.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
With Hugo Ekitike in such fine form, the big question now is, how does he continue to start in the big games when Alexander Isak is fully fit and up to speed?

Keeping both happy is going to be a challenge for Arne Slot...

üîó www.nytimes.com/athletic/663...

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text: Dominic Calvert-Lewin has his first Premier League goal for Leeds United.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Harry Kane scored his second hat-trick of the season as Bayern Munich beat Hoffenheim 4-1 at the PreZero Arena.

The England captain scored twice from the penalty spot to take his tally for the season to eight goals in just four Bundesliga games.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Wolves' miserable start to the season continues as they lose their fifth successive game after a 3-1 home defeat against newly-promoted Leeds United.

It is the first time since February 1971 under Don Revie that Leeds have won four league games in a row against Wolves.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Tyrick Mitchell's winner gave Crystal Palace a 2-1 win against West Ham United as they remain unbeaten in their last seven Premier League visits to the London Stadium.

Graham Potter's side are now without a win in their last eight home league games.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Chelsea goalkeeper Robert Sanchez brings down Bryan Mbeumo outside the box and is sent off for denying an obvious goalscoring opportunity after just five minutes.

With two Chelsea defenders covering, did referee Peter Bankes make the right decision?

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
After a lengthy VAR check, Bruno Fernandes gives Manchester United the lead against Chelsea after 14 minutes.

It's the Portuguese midfielder's 100th club goal on his 200th Premier League appearance.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca has made ùê≠ùê°ùê´ùêûùêû substitutions inside the opening 20 minutes at Old Trafford, including withdrawing Cole Palmer.

The England midfielder did not look impressed as he walked past Manchester United substitute and international teammate, Kobbie Mainoo, on the touchline.

author: yairwallach.bsky.social
text: Good chance of Israel being suspended from the Union of European Football Associations (UEFA) this week. This move would have devastating implications for Israeli football, and would be the most significant move of cultural sanction against Israel in decades.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Casemiro doubles Manchester United's lead against Chelsea after some statuesque defending from Enzo Maresca's side.

The Brazilian midfielder has scored three of his seven Premier League goals against the west London club.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Casemiro, who had earlier put Manchester United 2-0 up, is sent off for a second bookable offence and it's now 10 against 10. 

It's the fourth time the Brazilian has been shown his marching orders for United.

A lifeline for Chelsea.

author: aaronclerner.bsky.social
text: I know Viktor Gyokeres is a low-touch striker, but Benjamin Sesko having just 7 touches for Manchester United when they were up a man for an entire half is NASTY work.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
It's been an eventful 45 minutes at Old Trafford between Manchester United and Chelsea...

Is there any way back for Enzo Maresca's side?

author: beautifulgroan.bsky.social
text: This match has gone from funny to absolutely dire. Both sides are looking really poor now.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Casemiro's goal, before he was later sent off, proves pivotal as Manchester United extend their unbeaten home Premier League run against Chelsea to 13 games.

Robert Sanchez was dismissed inside five minutes before goals from Bruno Fernandes and the Brazilian midfielder wrapped up all three points.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
‚öΩÔ∏è Alex Iwobi (38')
‚öΩÔ∏è Harry Wilson (40')

What a turnaround from Fulham.

Two goals in 98 seconds see Marco Silva's side lead Brentford 2-1 at the break.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Manchester United have not won a Premier League game since March (3-0 against Leicester City) unless they scored a penalty or played against 10 men.

Even when they seemed to be in control, they let Chelsea back in, conceding from another set piece, resulting in a very nervy ending.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
But Ruben Amorim's side got the job done and can make it consecutive wins if they beat Brentford next weekend.

üìù @charpur.bsky.social

text:
No way üíî

What a sad loss and news to hear, it doesn't feel real.

Matt Beard was a good guy and great for the women's game. 

So sorry to his family & all who knew and loved him, wishing you all much love at this time.

Marco Silva's side beat Brentford 3-1 at Craven Cottage to win three league games in a row against them for just the second time, after winning their first three clashes back in 1928 and 1929.

text:
‚ÄúAggression‚Äù had long since become Ruben Amorim's buzzword. It was what his team had lacked in the Manchester derby. It was what they needed if they were to kick on under his stewardship. And, against Chelsea at Old Trafford, it was what Manchester United delivered.

text: Manchester City's 32.8% possession figure in today's game against Arsenal was the lowest that a team managed by Pep Guardiola has had in a top-flight league game.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Manchester City recorded their lowest ever average possession under Pep Guardiola in a top-flight league match today in his 601st fixture.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text: Mikel Arteta is now the first manager to avoid defeat in five consecutive league games against Pep Guardiola, with his Arsenal side winning two and drawing three across their last five Premier League meetings with Manchester City.

text:

text:
Sunderland have their first first-half goal of the season, and their first on the road to lead at Nottingham Forest.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

The three points move the side up to third in the Premier League as things stand.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

text:

text: Erling Haaland's hat-trick against Israel moves him past half a century of goals for Norway.

text:

text:
üï∞Ô∏è 53': Ayoub El Kaabi gives Olympiacos a lifeline from the penalty spot

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Barcelona have blown Olympiacos away, scoring four times in just 11 minutes.

Lamine Yamal's penalty started things off. His spot kick was followed by a smart finish from Marcus Rashford, who added another after Fermin Lopez had completed his first senior hat-trick.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

Fermin Lopez becomes the first Spanish player to score a Champions League hat-trick for Barcelona, while Marcus Rashford takes his tally in this season's competition to four.

text: Kind of remarkable to hear Diego Simeone saying his Atletico Madrid team need to learn from Arsenal how to be "clinical in different phases of the game". The last time he was here you could not have imagined Arsenal being held up as an exemplar of precision for a Simeone team.

text:

Virgil van Dijk then headed Arne Slot's side 2-1 ahead before Ibrahima Konate's thumping header put Liverpool in command.

They lead 3-1 at the break.

text:

Marc Guiu gave Enzo Maresca's side the lead, before Moises Caicedo doubled their advantage.

Wout Weghorst pulled one back from the spot, before two penalties of their own - from Enzo Fernandez and Estevao - put the hosts 4-1 ahead.

text:

author: amylawrence.bsky.social
text: Seems the 8pm kick offs make a difference to those with further to travel. Understand that anyone at risk of missing a last train has a problem but would be interested to know how many of, say, 30,000 early leavers unequivocally cannot get home otherwise. In other words, is it a need or a choice?

text:
Does it take 40 mins to get from your seat at the ground onto the tube? Is that on the basis of leaving a bit early? It's still tight on an 8pm kick off. 

Is it only night games that it's an issue? I only ask as I've noticed a habit of early leavers even for a 3pm or 4.30pm kick off.

text:

The 2025 KNVB Cup winners come back from behind to beat Aston Villa 2-1 at De Adelaarshorst.

The hosts let off fireworks prematurely before full-time, but their side held on to start the party in Deventer.

text:

Morgan Gibbs-White scores his first goal of the season from the penalty spot after Jan Bednarek was adjudged to have handled in the box.

text:

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
A different penalty taker, but the same outcome.

Igor Jesus scores his fifth Nottingham Forest goal and put Sean Dyche's side 2-0 up against Porto.

Nicolo Savona was initially booked for diving, but after a VAR check Forest were awarded their second spot kick of the night.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
It was a tale of two penalties at the City Ground as Sean Dyche got his Nottingham Forest tenure off to a winning start.

They were both scored - by Morgan Gibbs-White and Igor Jesus - as Forest beat Porto 2-0.

It's Nottingham Forest's first home win in Europe since 1995.

text:

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
There are no secrets in youth football. 

The super talent of Max Dowman was so obvious that Arsenal had to create a unique pathway for him.

It has led to him signing a scholarship with the club and Arsenal securing a remarkable talent.

üìù @amylawrence.bsky.social

author: amylawrence.bsky.social
text:
Ey up! I lived in Sheffield for a few years and remember those journeys well... 

Difference was 30-odd years ago we could drive down and it was free parking around Finsbury Park so never any worry about last trains. The only issue was when the designated driver had one too many. 

All the best!

author: amylawrence.bsky.social
text:
Very encouraging that Max Dowman's scholarship, leading to a first pro contract, is agreed. With the best youth there is always a risk they will be lured away. Arsenal have been smart in handling his elevation by mixing a special amount of opportunity and care.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text: Marc Guiu starts for Chelsea against Sunderland, the team with which the Spaniard spent 26 days on loan at the start of this season before being recalled by Enzo Maresca's side after Liam Delap suffered a hamstring injury.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Alejandro Garnacho scores his first goal for Chelsea.

The Argentinian's effort goes through the legs of Robin Roefs and gives Enzo Maresca's team an early lead against Sunderland.

We've seen that celebration before...

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Sunderland are level at Stamford Bridge, thanks to the old faithful, the tried and trusted, the long throw...

Chelsea can't clear and after a bit of pinball, Wilson Isidor pokes home ‚Äî it's his fourth goal of the season.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Fulham had the better of the opening exchanges, but it's Newcastle who take the lead.

Jacob Murphy capitalises, stealing the ball off Calvin Bassey, who lingers on the ball too long, to score his first Premier League goal of the season.

author: chrisdhwaugh.bsky.social
text:
Half-time: #NUFC 1-0 #FFC 

By standards of #NUFC in the PL this season, big chances for both teams.

Only Jacob Murphy - who has also missed one - has taken one, with a solo goal.

#NUFC dangerous in transition, but sloppy playing out from the back, giving #FFC openings.
#NEWFUL

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Sasa Lukic brings Fulham level, bravely heading in, and clashing heads with Sven Botman in the process.

The goals stands after a VAR check and a lengthy break in play as Botman received treatment.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
The Bayern Munich juggernaut thunders on.

Goals from Joshua Kimmich, Raphael Guerreiro and Lennart Karl earn Vincent Kompany's side a 3-0 victory over 10-man Borussia Monchengladbach ‚Äî Bayern maintain their 100% winning record in all competitions this season.

Thirteen games, thirteen wins.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
FT: Newcastle 2-1 Fulham

A sickener for Fulham as Bruno Guimaraes wins it for Newcastle United in the 90th minute, picking up the pieces as Bernd Leno parries a William Osula shot.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text: Chemsdine Talbi scores his first Sunderland goal to give them the lead against Chelsea at Stamford Bridge in the 93rd minute!

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Leicester City have only won one of their last eight matches. Their 1-0 defeat by Millwall leaves them eight points off the automatic promotion spots. 

Leicester stormed the Championship under Enzo Maresca ‚Äî they are not having it all their own way under Marti Cifuentes.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Sunderland are second in the Premier League.

Chemsdine Talbi's 93rd-minute winner gives Regis Le Bris' side victory against Chelsea at Stamford Bridge.

It was their toughest test of the season so far. But Sunderland just keep on surprising the Premier League ‚Äî they are taking it by storm.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Newcastle needed this.

Having twice been undone by late goals at St James‚Äô Park, losing to both Liverpool and Arsenal in heartbreaking fashion, Eddie Howe‚Äôs players inflicted the same on Fulham. A nervous stadium erupted.

Matheus Cunha's perfectly-placed finish, his first goal for Man United, gave the home side the lead before Casemiro's heavily deflected shot doubled their advantage.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

The visitors got off to the perfect start with two quick-fire goals from Bia Zaneratto and Dudinha, before captain Angelina was sent off for a foul on Ella Toone.

text: Highlight of the half for me was Burnley attempting two long throws, both being easily won by Gabriel, the second of which led to our second goal. You think set-pieces are your ally?

text:

I really don‚Äôt understand this ‚Äúrule‚Äù regarding a touch on the ball exempting doing whatever you want to the attacker in the box.

text:

text:

text:
Leeds United goalkeeper Lucas Perri made this miraculous save just moments before his side went up the other end and took the lead through Lukas Nmecha.

However, the Brazilian goalkeeper should have done better for Nottingham Forest's equaliser as Ibrahim Sangare levelled just two minutes later.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
A beauty from Emi Buendia.

The Argentinian midfielder scored his third Premier League goal of the season to give Aston Villa the lead against Bournemouth with a wonderful free kick.

Amadou Onana has doubled the lead for Unai Emery's side.

author: jacobtanswell.bsky.social
text: Shouldn't be lost how big an effort #AVFC put in that 1st half. Out-worked, out-hustled one of the most, if not the most, energetic sides in the league. Buendia's fitness, from now to even four months ago,is extraordinary. Emery always wants control but this has been very dynamic

author: jacobtanswell.bsky.social
text:
HT: #AVFC 2-0 Bournemouth

Villa have played, as Emery says, "very mature." Not got involved in the intended chaos of the visitors, crucially won their direct duels and matched, if not bettered, their work-rate. Rogers & Watkins positioning in either channel has given an out-ball

author: chrisdhwaugh.bsky.social
text:
Brentford 1-1 #NUFC 

Long throws had troubled #NUFC during the first half - & a goal come from another.

Kayode launches a long throw into the box, Pope comes for it, Botman is in front of him, flicks it on, but Schade merely nods in.

#BRENEW

author: chrisdhwaugh.bsky.social
text:

#BRENEW #NUFC

author: mattwoosie.bsky.social
text:
Full-time: Palace 0-0 Brighton

An even game, Palace did have the better chances but they lacked the finish as seems to be the case too often.

Tired towards the end. Sarr's chance in the first half the best one.

Mitchell outstanding, Canvot very good too. A strong defensive performance #CPFC

text:

Forest are unbeaten in their last 14 top-flight home games against Leeds, a run that stretches back to 1971.

text:
Brentford is a difficult place to visit.

After Newcastle United's 3-1 defeat to Keith Andrews' side, Manchester City remain the only team to visit the Gtech Community Stadium in the Premier League this season and walk away with three points.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

Unai Emery's side are now unbeaten in their last six Premier League games against Bournemouth.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Liverpool are looking to win consecutive away league games against Manchester City for the first time since 1991.

Follow live from the Etihad Stadium in a match that could have huge title implications ‚¨áÔ∏è

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
From zero to hero for Giorgi Mamardashvili.

The Liverpool goalkeeper brought down Jeremy Doku to give Manchester City a penalty, but made amends moments later down to his left to thwart Erling Haaland from the spot.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
13' - Erling Haaland's penalty is saved by Giorgi Mamardashvili ‚ùå

29' - Erling Haaland gives Manchester City the lead ‚öΩÔ∏è

You can't keep the Norwegian striker down for long.

Manchester City lead Liverpool at the Etihad after Haaland's 99th Premier League goal for the club.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
There is further controversy at the Etihad Stadium as Liverpool think they have equalised, but after an intervention from VAR it is ruled out.

Virgil van Dijk's header is chalked off after Andy Robertson, stood in an offside position, was adjudged to have impeded goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
It is not going Liverpool's way at the Etihad Stadium.

Virgil van Dijk thought he had equalised, but after it was ruled out by VAR, he could only flick a leg at Nico Gonzalez's strike which took it beyond the grasp of Giorgi Mamardashvili.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Jeremy Doku has surely put the result beyond doubt.

The Belgian winger caps a fine performance with a stunning strike.

Manchester City lead Liverpool 3-0 at the Etihad Stadium.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Manchester City deliver a statement win against the champions at the Etihad Stadium.

Goals from Erling Haaland, Nico Gonzalez and Jeremy Doku move Pep Guardiola's side to within four points of Arsenal.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Liverpool thought that had equalised against Manchester City when Virgil van Dijk arrowed a header into the bottom corner ‚Äì until a flag spoiled the celebrations.

Andy Robertson was controversially adjudged to have been in an offside position and a VAR review did not overturn the on-pitch decision.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Overall, though, Arne Slot's side were second best by a distance.

They do not look like title challengers, and while it is still very early in the season, it is difficult to see how Liverpool finish above either Arsenal or Manchester City.

Reckon you could score an overhead kick in these conditions?

Attempting it is one thing. Scoring one, in the snow, in a final, is another.

text:
Arsenal's u21 group game in the EFL Trophy tonight is effectively a knockout game.

If Arsenal win, they're through. Lose, they're out. Draw, there will be a penalty shootout. If they win it, they're through. Lose it, they're out. No result in the other game changes that picture.

author: afcdw.bsky.social
text: To add to the knockout feel, the exact same logic applies to Arsenal's opponents Cardiff City. They win (on penalties or not), they go through. They lose, they go out.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Nottingham Forest lead 1-0 at Anfield, and Liverpool are a little fortunate it's not more.

Murillo fired past Alisson to give Sean Dyche's side the lead. Igor Jesus thought he had Forest's second shortly after, but it was adjudged to have been handball in the build-up.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

Bournemouth are without a win in their last eight Premier League games against West Ham and have work to do if they want to change that...

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Liverpool needed a reaction after half-time... but Arne Slot's side conceded just 39 seconds into the second half. 

Nicolo Savona's emphatic finish put Nottingham Forest 2-0 up at Anfield.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Rob Edwards‚Äô first Premier League home win as Luton Town manager came against Crystal Palace in 2023-24.

author: afcdw.bsky.social
text: Wonder how Slot is going to blame the schedule for this one. Too close to the international break? Too many home games recently?

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Morgan Gibbs-White scores his fourth of the season and Nottingham Forest's third of the afternoon to secure all three points against Liverpool at Anfield. 

What a performance by Sean Dyche's side.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Nottingham Forest stun Liverpool at Anfield. 

A first clean sheet for Matz Sels since April, and he was barely tested by the home side's attack. 

Goals from Murillo, Nicolo Savona and Morgan Gibbs-White help Forest out of the bottom three, and they're unbeaten in three Premier League games.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

The Brazilian forward had given Keith Andrews' side a first-half lead from the spot, but goals from Danny Welbeck and Jack Hinshelwood secured all three points for the hosts.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
It has taken Newcastle United under six minutes to take the lead against Marseille.

Harvey Barnes, fresh from his brace against Manchester City on the weekend, continues his good run of form to open the scoring.

It is now four goals in three matches for the forward.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Watford‚Äôs Luca Kjerrumgaard will not want to watch this back.

With the goal at his mercy after Othmane Maamma‚Äôs shot hit the post, the striker fired over.

To make matters worse, Watford now trail Preston with Daniel Jebbison, who had a failed loan spell at Watford last season, on the scoresheet.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Jules Kounde's own goal has given Chelsea the lead against Barcelona.

Enzo Fernandez has had two goals disallowed ‚Äî Enzo Maresca will be relieved to see this one stand.

The visitors wanted an offside given against Marc Cucurella in the build-up.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
It has been a hectic first half between Marseille and Newcastle United, with the away side leading 1-0 at the break.

Darryl Bakola, and the majority of the fans in the Orange Velodrome, wanted a penalty after he went down in the box, but the referee instead booked the 17-year-old for simulation.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Ronald Araujo is sent off for Barcelona. 

He receives his second yellow card after fouling Marc Cucurella.

A goal down, and now a man down. It's not the first half Hansi Flick would have wanted.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
At half-time, Newcastle United led Marseille 1-0.

Less than five minutes after the break, Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang has a brace, either side of a disallowed Harvey Barnes goal.

A chaotic start to the second half.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

text:

author: amylawrence.bsky.social
text: Popped over to the other place to check on someone and chanced on these. Got me thinking. I‚Äôm old enough not to be bothered by angry strangers. But exposure to faceless hate on social media must be very disturbing for young people who don‚Äôt have the tools or perspective. It worries me.

author: amylawrence.bsky.social
text:
I‚Äôm totally fine Andy thanks.

text:

text:

text:

Kane was only brought on in the 60th minute...

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
This why there is so much excitement around Rayan Cherki.

His rabona cross is headed home by Phil Foden to put Manchester City 3-0 ahead against Sunderland.

Foden now has five goals in the past three games. Pep Guardiola's side are set to move to within two points behind Arsenal.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

Ruben Dias‚Äô great strike opened the scoring, Josko Gvardiol made it 2-0 soon after - Phil Foden rounded out the victory, heading home Rayan Cherki's magnificent rabona assist.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

Pep Guardiola‚Äôs side move within two points of the league leaders after their 3-0 win over Sunderland, while Everton are up to fifth after their victory over Nottingham Forest by the same scoreline.

text:

The France international made the most of a Joe Rodon error to open the scoring, before beating Lucas Perri to a cross and bundling the ball over the line to give Liverpool a rapid 2-0 lead over Leeds United.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

Goals from Dominic Calvert-Lewin and Anton Stach made it 2-2 against Liverpool, but Dominik Szoboszlai‚Äôs slotted finish has restored the defending champions‚Äô lead.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Ao Tanaka‚Äôs stoppage-time equaliser means the instant Premier League classic between Leeds United and Liverpool at Elland Road ends level.

The 3-3 result marks back-to-back draws against newly-promoted sides for Liverpool.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Two against Chelsea.
One against Arsenal.
One against Nottingham Forest.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Yang Hyun-Jun gives Celtic the lead against Rangers.

Questions will be asked about how he was allowed to dribble so easily through Rangers' defence before powering a shot past Jack Butland.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
A delightful finish from Morgan Gibbs-White.

Nottingham Forest have a way back into this game ‚Äî can they deny Aston Villa an 11th consecutive home win?

text: I'd act injured if I let in that McGinn goal too.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
John McGinn helps himself to a brace, taking advantage of John Victor's walkabouts. 
 
A blow for Nottingham Forest and Sean Dyche, who had managed to get themselves back in the game ‚Äî¬†but the hosts have now restored their two-goal lead.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Aston Villa return to winning ways in the Premier League with a 3-1 win against Nottingham Forest ‚Äî¬†and make it 11 consecutive wins at home.

Unai Emery's side move three points behind Arsenal and leapfrog Manchester City into second. 

Sean Dyche's side remain four points above the bottom three.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Rangers turned it around against Celtic.

Wilfried Nancy's side went into the break 1-0 up, but a brace from former Everton striker Youssef Chermiti and a goal from Tottenham Hotspur loanee Mikey Moore moves Danny Rohl's side level on points with Celtic.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Hwang Hee-chan converts from the spot, and Wolves double their lead against West Ham United. 

They have not won a Premier League game since last April ‚Äî¬†is that run going to end today?

text: Wolves would be top of a Premier League table for 2026.

text:

Nuno Espirito Santo's team have not had a single shot.

HALF TIME
WOLVES 3 (THREE) WEST HAM 0

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Thierno Barry's deft finish earns victory for Everton and ends Aston Villa's 11-game winning run at Villa Park.

Unai Emery's side toiled against a strong Everton rearguard and lose ground in the Premier League title race ‚Äî Arsenal are seven points clear following the weekend's results.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Clean through on goal, Senegal's Iliman Ndiaye drew a fantastic save from Morocco goalkeeper Yassine Bounou.

An entertaining but goalless affair in Rabat, where it is half-time in the Africa Cup of Nations final. 

How crucial could that save prove to be...

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
After all the chaos and furore from the decision to award Morocco a penalty, Brahim Diaz dinked his effort straight into Edouard Mendy's arms. A failed panenka.

Simply extraordinary.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Three minutes into extra-time, Pape Gueye shrugs off Achraf Hakimi before unleashing an unstoppable shot to give Senegal the lead against Morocco in the Africa Cup of Nations final.

Outraged and off the pitch 20 minutes ago, leading now.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Senegal win the Africa Cup of Nations. Pape Gueye's stunning extra-time strike proved the difference.

Does that tell the full story? Not even slightly.

A questionable penalty decision in Morocco's favour, Senegal's walk-off and fury, Brahim Diaz's failed panenka. 

That just scratches the surface.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Kai Havertz is back for Arsenal ‚Äî and back on the scoring sheet.

Mikel Arteta's side took the lead through Viktor Gyokeres, before Kairat equalised from the spot with Jorginho.

But the German has restored Arsenal's lead, with his first goal since against Manchester City in February last year.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
A fine strike from Florian Wirtz doubles Liverpool's lead against Qarabag at Anfield.

Arne Slot's side are 2-0 up and look set to seal their place in the last 16.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Kylian Mbappe has 12 goals in the Champions League this season ‚Äî a tally that would have made him top scorer in 62 of the previous 70 seasons in the European Cup/Champions League.

@will_jeanes

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text: Kylian Mbappe already has 35 goals for Real Madrid this season. It's January.

author: plnews.bsky.social
text:
GOAL - Hojlund

Napoli 2-1 Chelsea
UEFA Champions League

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Napoli have turned it around against Chelsea.

Enzo Fernandez had given Liam Rosenior's side the lead from the spot ‚Äî but goals from Antonio Vergara and Manchester United loanee Rasmus Hojlund means Antonio Conte's side have the advantage going into the break.

text:

PSG 1-1 Newcastle
UEFA Champions League

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Arsenal have added to their lead against Kairat, with Gabriel Martinelli tapping into an empty net.

The touch from Christian Norgaard in the build-up is scrumptious.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Benfica have come from behind to lead Real Madrid at Estadio da Luz. 

Vangelis Pavlidis' penalty has given the Portuguese giants the advantage at half-time.

Reckon Jose Mourinho is enjoying himself?

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Mohamed Salah's first goal for Liverpool since November 1 puts Arne Slot's side 3-0 up against Qarabag.

A fine free-kick teed up by Dominik Szoboszlai.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text: A moment of brilliance from Hugo Ekitike, who runs from inside his own half to put Liverpool further in front against Qarabag.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
It's all level in Naples.

Chelsea were trailing 2-1 but are now level against Napoli after Joao Pedro's stonking hit from outside of the box.

author: theshortfuse.bsky.social
text: Brando Bailey-Joseph comes on to make his senior debut for Arsenal. The 17-year old has been at the club since he was 6 years old and signed his first professional contract 7 months ago.

author: goonerak.bsky.social
text:
Welcome to Brando Bailey-Joseph, the 926th player to play a competitive first team game for The Arsenal.

text: Frimpong & Doku were both injured today. I'm glad we were able to rest a lot of players.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
A magnificent solo effort from Joao Pedro may have earned a huge victory for Liam Rosenior and Chelsea.

The Brazilian carried the ball from the halfway line before finishing expertly to put his side 3-2 in front against Napoli.

text:

Benfica will play either Inter or Real Madrid for a place in the last 16 ‚Äî Real were third in the table going into this evening.

text: Harvey Elliott starts for #AVFC and makes his sixth appearance. Last game came in October having been, & remaining, in limbo. Everyone I‚Äôve spoken to says the same thing - extremely polite, hard-working, well-liked, goes to every home match and wishes players well beforehand

author: jacobtanswell.bsky.social
text:

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
We're not sure how much Alexander Schlager knew about it; whether he meant it or not.

The Red Bull Salzburg goalkeeper saves with his feet to deny Harvey Elliott in the early moments of their game against Aston Villa.

Shades of Rene Higuita?

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
A win for Roma tonight would secure their place in the top eight in the Europa League.

But Gianluca Mancini has just made their task tougher. 

The defender brings down Panathinaikos' Milos Pantovic, and the yellow originally shown by the referee is upgraded to a red.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
It's a mess from Aston Villa in defence.

First Tyrone Mings gives possession up in his own box, before Victor Lindelof taps into his own goal.

Red Bull Salzburg lead at Villa Park.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
It has unravelled so quickly for Rangers in Portugal.

They took the lead after six minutes through Djeidi Gassama ‚Äî¬†but it has been downhill since then. 

Goals from Rodrigo Mora, Francisco Moura and an Emmanuel Fernandez own goal has given Porto a 3-1 lead.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
A win for Celtic tonight and they will progress into the Europa League knockout stages. 

And at the break, it is looking good: they're 3-1 up against Utrecht.

Benjamin Nygren opened the scoring before Nick Viergever put into his own net. Arne Engels added a third from the spot.

author: jacobtanswell.bsky.social
text:
Goal, Salzburg. 2-0.

#AVFC continue as they left off.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Aston Villa concede another.

Red Bull Salzburg double their lead ‚Äî Moussa Yeo, who has just come on the pitch, smartly converts. 

Unai Emery's side are already through, but the Austrians are keeping their hopes of progressing alive.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Youngs Boys were 2-0 down to Stuttgart, but they're level now. 

And Sandro Lauper has just entered his nomination for goal of the tournament. 

Hovering on the edge of the box, he connects with Edimilson Fernandes' ball from the corner ‚Äî¬†and it leaves Fabian Bredlow with no chance.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
It's been a good evening for Nottingham Forest and Igor Jesus. 

Sean Dyche's side lead Robbie Keane's Ferencvarosi 3-0 ‚Äî the Brazilian has a brace.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
It's a big goal in Greece. 

Rafa Benitez's Panathinaikos lead Roma 1-0 ‚Äî¬†and it's Vicente Taborda with the finish.

As it stands, Gian Piero Gasperini's side are sliding out of the top eight.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Tyrone Mings, who for the first goal Aston Villa conceded tonight, redeems himself.

His powerful header levels the game at Villa Park ‚Äî¬†Unai Emery's side have come back from 2-0 down against Red Bull Salzburg.

author: jacobtanswell.bsky.social
text: And just like that... Kadan Young crosses low and accurately to the onrushing Jamaldeen Jimoh-Aloba, who scores. What a moment for the 19-year-old. 3-2 #AVFC

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Roma, who are down to 10 players, have equalised in Greece against Panathinaikos.

Jan Ziolkowski scores his first goal for the club ‚Äî¬†and it looks to be enough for a top-eight finish for Gian Piero Gasperini's side.

Arsenal beat Leeds United 4-0 to end a three-match winless run in the Premier League to go seven points clear at the top, for now at least.

Goals from Martin Zubimendi, Viktor Gyokeres, Gabriel Jesus and a Karl Darlow own goal secured the points for Mikel Arteta's side at Elland Road.

text: Leeds have a -11 goal difference. -9 of that has come against Arsenal.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
West Ham are enjoying London derbies this month.

Nuno Espirito Santo's side are 2-0 up against Chelsea at Stamford Bridge thanks to Jarrod Bowen and  Crysencio Summerville. It could have been more before the break, too.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Liam Rosenior made seven changes to the side that won in Naples on Wednesday, giving a chance to some fringe players in the Chelsea squad.

He was forced into making three more at half-time against West Ham, with his side lucky to be only 2-0 down at Stamford Bridge.

Chelsea come from 2-0 down at half-time to win 3-2 against West Ham at Stamford Bridge, Enzo Fernandez with the winner in the 92nd minute.

Liam Rosenior's half-time substitutes worked wonders in the second half after the Chelsea manager made seven changes to his starting XI.

text: Ahem

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Never before had Chelsea come back to win from 2-0 down at half-time in a Premier League game. 

And yet, in the disbelieving din of Stamford Bridge, Enzo Fernandez‚Äôs stoppage-time goal achieved that for Liam Rosenior's side.

text:
Another classic is brewing on Merseyside.

Anthony Gordon opened the scoring in front of the Kop at Anfield, but a quickfire Hugo Ekitike brace has given Liverpool the lead at half-time. His second was a thing of beauty.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Liam Rosenior says he accepts the responsibility for lifting the mood of Chelsea supporters and hopes they will one day say his appointment was the best decision in the club‚Äôs history.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
Liverpool came from behind to defeat Newcastle 4-1 at Anfield ‚Äì their first Premier League win of 2026.

There was an emotional finale too, as Ibrahima Konate poked in the fourth and was mobbed by his team-mates. It was Konate's first appearance for Liverpool following the death of his father.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text:
After three games without a win, Arsenal needed a reaction against Leeds.

Courage and commitment helped them navigate a tempestuous atmosphere at Elland Road.

Was this a season-defining performance for Arsenal?

author: amylawrence.bsky.social
text:
Hello Sunday morning. 

It was reaction time at noisy Elland Road. The walls could have closed in and Arsenal reacted strongly to push them away. This 4-0, the punches a mix of set pieces to start them off and sweet technical goals to add flourish, felt important.

Marco Silva‚Äôs side drew level from 2-0 down thanks to Kevin‚Äôs stoppage-time stunner, but Benjamin Sesko restored their lead, moving Manchester United back up to fourth.

A 3-1 win for Manchester City on the night, and a 5-1 victory on aggregate, puts Pep Guardiola's side through to the Carabao Cup final. 

First-half goals from Omar Marmoush (two) and Tijjani Reijnders extended the home side's advantage.

Anthony Elanga scored a consolation for Newcastle United.

author: theathleticfc.bsky.social
text: Pep Guardiola says Manchester City intends to write to the English Football League to request a rule change so that Marc Guehi is available for the Carabao Cup final against Arsenal.
